algorithm_technique: Binary search on the answer (stability factor), Sparse Table for RMQ (GCD) queries.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest possible length of the longest stable subarray after modifying at most k elements.
problem_summary_technical: Binary search for the minimum stability factor. Use Sparse Table for O(1) GCD queries on subarrays to check stability.
key_insights: The problem asks for a minimum value, suggesting binary search on the answer.
Efficiently querying the GCD of any subarray is crucial, making Sparse Table a good fit.
The check function needs to count stable subarrays of a given length, which can be done greedily.
